intro: Rudgea corocoroensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Rudgea corocoroensis is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its beauty.
